escort verb [T]
(GO WITH)
to go with a person or vehicle, especially to make certain that he, she, or it leaves or arrives safely: Several little boats escorted the sailing ship into the harbour. Security guards escorted the intruders from the building. The police escorted her to the airport, and made sure that she left the country.
to go with someone and show them a place: People on the tour will be escorted by an expert on archaeology.

escort verb [T]
(AS SOCIAL COMPANION)
formal to go to a social event with someone, especially a person of the opposite sex: Who will be escorting her to the ball?
